Title.evidence: Title: Randomised Controlled Trial Comparing No-Touch and Conventional Techniques for Autogenous Arteriovenous Fistula Creation

Trial_Design.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment were reported in two RCTs, with one using envelopes.

Intervention.evidence: comparing conventional and no-touch techniques for AVF creation

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the primary patency rate from 6 months to 2 years.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation methods and allocation concealment were reported in two RCTs, with one using envelopes.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 699 patients were included, with 360 in the conventional group and 339 in the no-touch group.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The primary patency rate was significantly higher in the no-touch group (OR 0.46, 95% CI 0.31–0.68; P < 0.0001).

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding sources were not reported.

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding sources were not reported.
